Always deterministic for CVODE.
Sets the value of an integrator setting (e.g. absolute_tolerance)

inbodydescription.para: Values and keys are stored in the settings std::map, which is updated in every call to setValue. In addition, changing CVODE-specific parameters requires a call into the CVODE library to synchronize CVODE's internal memory with the settings std::map.

briefdescription.para: Sets tolerance for individual species.
Sets tolerance based on concentration of species.

simplesect.para: FY First converts the concentration tolerances to amount tolerances by multiplying the compartment volume of species. Whichever is smaller will be stored as absolute_tolerance and used in the integration process.

briefdescription.para: Gets tolerance based on concentration of species.
Reset all integrator settings to their respective default values.
Fix tolerances for SBML tests.

simplesect.para: JKM, WBC, ETS, MTK In order to ensure that the results of the SBML test suite remain valid, this method enforces a lower bound on tolerance values. Sets minimum absolute and relative tolerances to Config::CVODE_MIN_ABSOLUTE and Config::CVODE_MIN_RELATIVE resp.

briefdescription.para: Main integration routine.
Reset time to zero and reinitialize model.

simplesect.para: WBC, ETS, MTK Applies events which occur before time zero. Reinitializes CVODE and the executable model.

briefdescription.para: Gets the integrator listener.
Sets the integrator listener.
Does a RT type check which throws if it fails, EVEN IF RTTI IS DISABLED.
Does a size check which throws if it fails.
Does a index check which throws if it is out of bound.

memberdef.name: cvodeDyDtFcn

briefdescription.para: A RoadRunner integrator based on CVODE; serves as RoadRunner's main integrator for ODEs.

simplesect.para: WBC, ETS, MTK Provides a wrapper around CVODE from the SUNDIALS suite. CVODE has two main solvers: an Adams-Moulton solver for non-stiff problems, and a backward differentiation formula (BDF) solver for stiff problems. See: https://computation.llnl.gov/casc/sundials/documentation/toms_sundials.pdf
